arm_group.description: Women with lower urinary tract symptoms

brief_summary.textblock:
Women with pelvic organ prolapse often accompany with urinary symptoms or sexual
      dysfunction, and analyzing the association will be helpful to identify the indication of
      proper management. Therefore, the aim of this study is to identify the above associations by
      perineal sonography.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Association of Pelvic Organ Prolapse Severity and Urinary Symptoms and Sexual Function

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  all patients with lower urinary tract symptoms and will undergo urodynamic studies

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  none

study_pop.textblock: Patients with lower urinary tract symptoms

facility.name: Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology, National Taiwan University Hospital

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology, National Taiwan University Hospital

primary_outcome.description: To assess the correlation of bladder descent and lower urinary tract symptoms, and identify which symptoms is best correlated with bladder descent during Vulsalva maneuver.
primary_outcome.measure: To assess the correlation of bladder descent and lower urinary tract symptoms.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: To identify which parameters of sexual dysfunction is best correlated with the bladder descent.
secondary_outcome.measure: To identify the correlation of bladder descent with sexual dysfunction.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
